entry.title: DeadLineTodo Development Log
entry.content:
Introduction

DeadLineTodo is an app focused on tracking and recording task durations and deadlines. It has been launched on the App Store and recommended by the mergeek.com community.

Feature Overview

The app allows users to add to-dos with deadlines and estimated completion times, visually displaying the relationship between task size and the deadline using progress blocks. Additionally, the app quantifies all tasks, making user actions more visualized.

TODO

  • Basic UI Setup âœ”ï¸ 2024/1/20
  • Basic Functionality Implementation âœ”ï¸ 2024/2/10
  • Reminder Syncing âœ”ï¸ 2024/2/13
  • Global Search âœ”ï¸ 2024/2/14
  • UI Style Enhancement âœ”ï¸ 2024/2/17
  • Efficiency Score Algorithm Optimization âœ”ï¸ 2024/2/17
  • User Settings Persistence âœ”ï¸ 2024/2/18
  • Urgent Reminders âœ”ï¸ 2024/2/20
  • Task Timer âœ”ï¸ 2024/2/24
  • Support for Traditional Chinese and English âœ”ï¸ 2024/2/25
  • Recurring Tasks âœ”ï¸ 2024/3/02
  • Set Start Date âœ”ï¸ 2024/3/04
  • Daily Task Widgets âœ”ï¸ 2024/3/25
  • Dark Mode âœ”ï¸ 2024/4/17
  • Full Calendar Syncing âœ”ï¸ 2024/5/10
  • Full Reminder Syncing âœ”ï¸ 2024/5/15
  • Redesign App Icon âœ”ï¸ 2024/5/23
  • Custom Task Completion Time âœ”ï¸ 2024/7/10
  • More Widget Sizes âœ”ï¸ 2024/7/20
  • Custom Completion Duration
  • Difference Between Estimated and Actual Time Statistics
  • User Guide
  • Redesign Completed Tasks UI

entry.title: Welcome!
entry.content:
Welcome!

Welcome to my blog! I am a Chinese high school student who loves coding ğŸ’» and photography ğŸ“·. I enjoy software development and algorithm design, and Iâ€™m currently studying A Levels, competitive programming and computer vision.

Here, you can find a variety of content, including but not limited to:

  • Study Notes
  • Logs
  • Tutorials and Guides

Tips

You can switch between dark and light themes using the moon/sun icon in the bottom right corner. Click on the search icon to perform a global search within the blog for any characters. The site also supports sharing on Twitter and Facebook. While reading blog posts, youâ€™ll find an article outline on the right side, allowing you to jump directly to the section youâ€™re interested in by clicking on the title.

For the best experience, I recommend visiting the site on a tablet or computer.

My Photography Site

I also invite you to visit my other website: https://zs-andy.github.io.
Here, youâ€™ll find my photography works and related writings.
